content.description: Sit start with a left hand sidepull and a right hand crimp. From there, pull up to a big left hand sidepull (crux),  position the feet, then bump the left hand up the oblique shelf, reach a right hand jug, and top it out.
content.protection: A pad or two, the landing is good, but it is sloping and has several rocks outside of the fall zone.
content.location: This ascends the center-right face of Rattlesnaker's south face.

content.description: Sit start with a right hand gaston, an inverted left hand pinch, and a left heel hook. From there, pull off the ground and reach a left hand jug (crux), use a series of good edges with the right hand on the face, continue bumping the left hand up the arete, and finish it off using the jugs on top.
content.protection: A pad or two will work, the landing is good, but it is sloping, and there are some rocks surrounding the fall zone.
content.location: This ascends the south arete on the south face of Rattlesnaker Rock.

content.description:
Consequence of Kick is a solid lowball that begins with a difficult two-finger thrutch and finishes with some easy movement on good edges.

Sit start with a left hand sidepull, a right hand on a horizontal rail, and a high left foot edge. From there, pull up and hit a right hand, two-finger tooth (crux), follow with the left to an edge, then work the diagonal rail up the remainder of the rock, and top it out.

The arete out to the left is off for this problem.
content.protection: A pad should do it, the landing is pretty good.
content.location:
It ascends the center of the south face of Rattlesnaker Rock. The climbs in between

Gnaturita Knocks

and

Whitewater Wish

.
